entries.meaning: A dish (usually meat) prepared by braising.
examples: Pot roast is typically a braise, as is osso buco.
Braised cabbage is cooked in a braise of sliced bacon, one or two thickly sliced onions, one or two sliced carrots, parsley, thyme, a bay leaf, and stock to nearly cover.

verbs.description: braise (third-person singular simple present braises, present participle braising, simple past and past participle braised)

entries.meaning: (cooking) To cook in a small amount of liquid, in a covered pan, somewhere between steaming and boiling.
Alternative spelling of braze (joining non-ferrous metal using a molten filler metal)
Pagellus bogaraveo, syn. Pagellus centrodontus (sea bream)
